reviews.text:
I stayed here for 2 nights and really enjoyed it. Location is convenient with tram and Garibaldi station nearby, plus a supermarket around the corner. Check-in was warm and professional, thanks Nikolaos who was exceptionally polite, professional, helpful, kind and hospitable (really the best Front Office team member I’ve met here!!!) throughout my stay every time I saw him & Victoria who was very friendly and warm. Room was spotless with a huge comfy bed, strong shower, and all essential amenities like bathrobe/slippers. Housekeeping service was perfect. Breakfast was simple but tasty with plenty of choice (both hot and cold essentials), and the bar made a great Campari Spritz.
The building is older but well maintained, the common areas (lobby, restaurant, elevators, corridors, etc.) are cozy and smell good, and everything worked perfectly, including the AC in my room. Lots of thoughtful touches around the hotel that make guests feel well informed via QR codes. Simple, clean, friendly, reliable, and comfortable - exactly what you want from a Holiday Inn. I can highly recommend.

The service and room here were 5-stars. We were greeted right away when we walked through the doors and offered water. We arrived early and they were able to get us into a room right away. The staff at the front desk were really helpful with directions and helping us get a Taxi on our departure. The room was great, we were close to the elevator but did not hear any noise. Room was clean and modern, perfect size for 2 people. Breakfast was also great, good options. It is also only a few minutes walk to the metro station. They provide luggage store as well, which we took advantage of for our day trip to Verona.

We stayed for one night 2 rooms. Rooms were very nice, clean and quiet with mini fridge and a tea kettle. Breakfast was good for Italy. The hotel has parking for 18 euros. The location is good if you want to come withe cat and use public transportation around Milano, but you can find better options if you want to visit the city center. The neighborhood around the hotel is very nice with restaurants etc, but not a main tourist attraction (except the vertical forest…).

I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Garibaldi in Milan and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is modern, clean, and perfectly located, making it easy to get around the city whether you’re there for business or sightseeing.

The rooms were comfortable and well-equipped, and I appreciated how quiet it was at night despite being in a busy area. The breakfast was delicious with a good variety of options to start the day right.

But what truly made my stay exceptional was the service. I want to give a special mention to Xenia at the reception desk. She was absolutely amazing — incredibly friendly, professional, and helpful with everything from local recommendations to arranging transportation. Her warm attitude and genuine care made me feel very welcome and added a personal touch to my trip.

Highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Milan!

Great inexpensive hotel.
Been here twice, once on a business trip and another with my wife and always got treated wonderfully buy the welcoming staff, especially Xenia who is always helpful.
Clean rooms, tasty breakfast and amazing staff.
Totally recommend!
